Description: THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE'S PROPOSAL "CLIMATE CHANGE AND STRIPED BASS RECRUITMENT IN THE CHOPTANK AND PATUXENT RIVERS" WILL RECEIVE $249,293 FOR A 2-YEAR RESEARCH PROJECT THAT WILL UNDERTAKE SEVERAL TASKS INCLUDING:   -USE A PLANKTON SCOPE AND NET TO SAMPLE AND QUANTIFY ZOOPLANKTON ABUNDANCE, STRIPED BASS EGG AND LARVAE, AND FINFISH IN THE CHOPTANK AND PATUXENT RIVERS;  -CONDUCT AN ANALYSIS OF THE STRIPED BASS EGG AND LARVAE DISTRIBUTION AND ZOOPLANKTON DISTRIBUTION OBTAINED FROM SAMPLING;  -DEVELOP A SPAWNING HABITAT MODEL FOR STRIPED BASS  -EXAMINE EXISTING HISTORICAL AND HYDROGRAPHIC DATA TO INFORM A MODEL OF STRIPED BASS RECRUITMENT AS IT RELATES TO ZOOPLANKTON DISTRIBUTION.  THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN SEVERAL PRODUCTS AND TOOLS THAT WILL BE USEFUL FOR FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING.

THE VIRGINIA INSTITUTE OF MARINE SCIENCE (VIMS)'S PROPOSAL "ESTIMATING FISH DENSITY AND PRODUCTION ENHANCEMENT DERIVED FROM RESTORED SALT MARSH EDGE HABITATS IN CHESAPEAKE BAY" WILL RECEIVE $401,541 FOR A 3-YEAR RESEARCH PROJECT. THE VIMS RESEARCH TEAM WILL CONDUCT COMPREHENSIVE EXAMINATION OF FIVE SALT MARSH HABITAT SITES IN THE MIDDLE PENINSULA OF VIRGINIA. MONITORING ACTIVITIES AT THESE SITES WILL INCLUDE:  -SEASONAL COMPARATIVE NEKTON (SWIMMING AQUATIC ORGANISMS) SAMPLING -STEM COUNTING OF VEGETATION IN THE LOW MARSH TO OBTAIN VEGETATION DENSITY -PLACING SENSORS ALONG THE SHORELINES TO RECORD INUNDATION DURATION, DEPTH, AND WATER TEMPERATURE AT EACH LOCATION -IDENTIFYING CERTAIN SPECIES BY NATURAL OR RESTORED SALT MARSH EDGE HABITAT  FOLLOWING THIS SAMPLING EFFORT, RESEARCHER WILL PERFORM STATISTICAL EXAMINATION OF THE COLLECTED DATA, INTEGRATING IT INTO PRODUCTIVITY TOOLS FOR SALT MARSH HABITATS AND LIVING SHORELINES. FINAL, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL DEVELOP &A

THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND EASTERN SHORE'S PROPOSAL "TROPHIC ROLE, ENERGY DENSITIES AND FATTY ACIDS COMPOSITION OF FORAGE FISHES, AND THEIR MAJOR PREY TAXA IN THE MID-ATLANTIC ESTUARIES" WILL RECEIVE $450,000 FOR A 3-YEAR RESEARCH PROJECT THAT WILL UNDERTAKE SEVERAL TASKS INCLUDING:   -COLLECT TARGETED FISH (SUMMER FLOUNDER, BAY ANCHOVY, JUVENILE SPOT, AND WEAKFISH) SPECIMENS, AS WELL AS MYSIDS, MESOZOOPLANKTON, AND BENTHIC MACROINVERTEBRATES BY CONDUCTING SEASONAL SAMPLINGS OF THE MANOKIN RIVER IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND MARYLAND'S COASTAL BAYS (ON THE ATLANTIC OCEAN);  -ANALYZE THESE SPECIMENS IN A LABORATORY TO EVALUATE ENERGY DENSITY TRANSFERS RELATING TO THE FOOD CHAIN; AND  -MEASURE WATER QUALITY SEASONALLY AT EACH SITE THAT THE MARINE LIFE IS SAMPLED.  THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN PRODUCTS AND TOOLS THAT WILL BE USEFUL FOR FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING.

TITLE: MUSSEL POWER OVERVIEW: SINCE 2019, THE ANACOSTIA WATERSHED SOCIETY (AWS)'S MUSSEL POWER ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM HAS BEEN A UNIQUE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN AWS, PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS, THE WILLIAM S. SCHMIDT OUTDOOR EDUCATION CENTER, AND NATIONAL PARK SERVICE NATIONAL CAPITAL PARKS EAST. THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO RE ESTABLISH HEALTHY MUSSEL POPULATIONS WHILE ENGAGING HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATION EXPERIENCES. THE PROGRAM INCLUDES PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS FOR TEACHERS, INTRODUCTORY CLASSROOM WORK AND MUSSEL CARE BY STUDENTS, A FIELD STUDY ON THE ANACOSTIA RIVER, AND PARTICIPATION IN AUTHENTIC HANDS ON MUSSEL RESTORATION WORK. AWS PLANS TO ADD 5 SCHOOLS PER YEAR TO GET TO FULL SYSTEMIC IMPLEMENTATION IN ALL 29 HIGH SCHOOLS BY SPRING 2026.

TITLE: ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY CAPACITY BUILDING IN THE CHESAPEAKE REGION: A REGIONAL OUTDOOR LEARNING NETWORK INITIATIVE AND EQUITABLE YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NOAA  OVERVIEW: THE TRUST SEEKS TO INCREASE REGIONAL CAPACITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION. WHILE A GREAT DEAL OF PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE OVER THE COURSE OF THE LAST DECADE TO INCREASE UNDERSTANDING, ABILITY, AND COLLABORATIVE INFRASTRUCTURE TO ADVANCE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY INITIATIVES AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL, SIGNIFICANT LEADERSHIP, TECHNICAL, AND SUSTAINABILITY CHALLENGES STILL EXIST. THE TRUST THREE-YEAR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THESE CHALLENGES AND INCREASE BOTH STATE AND LOCAL CAPACITY FOR PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION BY CONVENING PARTNERS AND PROVIDING FUNDS AND TRAINING TO BUILD CAPACITY AND EMPOWER (1) STATE LEVEL NETWORKS COMPRISED OF STATE AGENCIES, SCHOOL SYSTEMS, AND NON-PROFIT PARTNERS TO EITHER DEVELOP NEW STRATEGIES TO ACCELERATE THE ADOPTION OF ENVIRON

TITLE: UPPER SUSQUEHANNA WATERSHED PROJECT  OVERVIEW: THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES IN MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL GRADE BANDS IN TWO SCHOOL DISTRICTS. OTSEGO COUNTY CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION (OCCA) EDUCATORS WILL PROVIDE 17 HOURS OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO TEACHER TEAMS IN EACH SCHOOL, WILL SUPPORT TEACHERS WITH MONTHLY FOLLOW-UP MEETINGS, AND WILL BE AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS. OCCA WILL ALSO WORK WITH THE CREATING RURAL OPPORTUNITIES PARTNERSHIP (CROP) IN THREE SCHOOLS TO REACH 70 STUDENTS IN THIRD THROUGH SIXTH GRADES. OCCA WILL PROVIDE IN-DEPTH TRAINING AND WILL SERVE AS MWEE FACILITATORS FOR CROP EDUCATORS BETWEEN VISITS. CROP PROGRAMMING CONTINUES THROUGH THE SUMMER, ALLOWING STEWARDSHIP AND CIVIC ACTION PROJECTS TO BE EXTENDED THROUGH THE SUMMER MONTHS.

TITLE: THIRTEEN MOONS: INDIGENOUS KNOWLEDGE AND CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE PEDAGOGIES FOR CONSERVATION, SUSTAINABILITY, AND STEWARDSHIP OVERVIEW: THIS UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND PROJECT WILL ENHANCE CAPACITY-BUILDING EFFORTS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY, SUSTAINABILITY, AND CLIMATE CHANGE EDUCATION IN THE CHESAPEAKE REGION BY ESTABLISHING A NEW PARTNERSHIP-BASED NETWORK FOR FOSTERING STUDENT COMPETENCIES IN CONSERVATION, SUSTAINABILITY, AND STEWARDSHIP IDENTITIES IN STUDENTS THROUGH THE ELABORATION OF INDIGENOUS KNOWLEDGE AND CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE PEDAGOGIES INTO NEXT GENERATION SCIENCE STANDARDS-BASED CURRICULA. THE PARTNERSHIP TEAM CONSISTS OF UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND (UMD) AND OHIO UNIVERSITY SCHOLARS, PISCATAWAY CONOY TRIBAL MEMBERS, TEACHER EDUCATORS, CURRICULUM SPECIALISTS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY EXPERTS AS WELL AS SCHOOL DISTRICT LEADERS, CLASSROOM TEACHERS, AND NONFORMAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATORS. UMD'S TEAM WILL WORK TO EXPAND THE SYSTEMIC INTEGRATION OF MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL

TITLE: WILLIAMS VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY & SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT OVERVIEW: THE WILLIAMS VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT AND MEMBERS OF THE PENNSYLVANIA ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY TASK FORCE PROPOSES TO DEVELOP A DISTRICTWIDE, SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PLAN WHICH INCLUDES EMBEDDING SYSTEMIC MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEES) (AT LEAST ONE PER GRADE BAND) INTO THE CURRICULUM AT THE WILLIAMS VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT. SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TEACHER PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ON MWEES, ENHANCING OUTDOOR LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES ON CAMPUS, AND DEVELOPING A GREEN TEAM TO IMPROVE NETWORKING, PROMOTE THE VALUE OF ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY, AND ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY. THESE GOALS ALIGN WITH NOAA'S TOP TWO PRIORITIES. THE WILLIAMS VALLEY SCHOOLS DISTRICT'S ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY & SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL ADDRESS PA SCIENCE STANDARDS K-12, BY ENHANCING OUTDOOR LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, PROVIDING TEACHERS AND STAFF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ON

TITLE: OUR ELIZABETH RIVER, OUR RESPONSIBILITY OVERVIEW: TO PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY REGARDING THE ELIZABETH RIVER AND CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ACHIEVE IMPROVED ENGAGEMENT IN A DISTRESSED URBAN SCHOOL SYSTEM, THE NONPROFIT ELIZABETH RIVER PROJECT (ERP) PRESENTS OUR ELIZABETH RIVER, OUR RESPONSIBILITY, WITH PARTNERS TO PROVIDE INQUIRY-BASED, HANDS-ON, DEI-FOCUSED, SYSTEMIC MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE (MWEE) AND TEACHER PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ADDRESSING NOT ONLY STEM SCIENCES BUT PROVIDING LOCAL CONTEXT THROUGH CULTURE, HISTORY AND ART WITH THE HELP OF THREE BLACK UNIVERSITY PROFESSORS IN A NEW PARTNERSHIP. THE GOAL WILL BE TO TRANSFORM SCIENCE EDUCATION IN PORTSMOUTH'S 4TH GRADES, SO THAT ALL STUDENTS GOING FORWARD IMPLEMENT INCLUSIVE, SYSTEMIC MWEES, INCREASING THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE ELIZABETH RIVER AND CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEMS WHILE TAKING ACTION TO CREATE A RESILIENT ECOSYSTEM AND PORTSMOUTH PUBLIC SCHOOLS EMBEDS MWEES INTO THE CURRICULUM WITH A LONG-TERM COMM

TITLE: ESSEX ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY COLLABORATIVE  OVERVIEW: ESSEX COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS WILL PARTNER WITH FRIENDS OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK AND THE CENTER FOR EDUCATIONAL PARTNERSHIPS TO CREATE A SYSTEMIC AND SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY EDUCATION PROGRAM TO REACH STUDENTS IN THE ELEMENTARY, INTERMEDIATE, AND HIGH SCHOOLS THROUGH TARGETED GRADE LEVELS AND COURSES THAT EMBED QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING FOCUSED ON ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE, AND MODERN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING PRACTICES. THIS COLLABORATIVE WILL SUSTAIN TEACHER CAPACITY TO BUILD, DEVELOP, AND IMPLEMENT MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEES) INTO THE EXISTING SCIENCE CURRICULUM. FURTHER, THE COLLABORATIVE WILL UTILIZE THE RESOURCES CREATED BY NOAA VIA BAY BACKPACK LESSONS; THE FRIENDS OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK OUTDOOR LEARNING SITES AND LOWER RIVER EDUCATION LESSON PLANS; AND, EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO GUIDE CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, INSTRUCTIONAL PLANNING, AND LESSON DELIVER

TITLE: OYSTERS AS A KEYSTONE SPECIES IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY OVERVIEW: THIS PROJECT WILL REVIVE AN EDUCATION PROGRAM THAT WAS CANCELED DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT HIRING A FULL-TIME EDUCATOR AND WILL ASSIST THE NONPROFIT IN BUILDING CAPACITY TO RETURN TO OFFERING LARGE SCALE EDUCATION PROGRAMS. AS PART OF THIS GRANT, THE CENTER WILL PROVIDE IN DEPTH OYSTER EDUCATION TO ALL 4TH GRADE STUDENTS IN TALBOT COUNTY, MARYLAND. AS PART OF THIS PROGRAM, THE CENTER WILL OFFER A MINIMUM OF 8 HOURS OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH A TWO PART PROGRAM THAT SHARES THE OUTDOOR FIELD EXPERIENCE ACTIVITIES WITH TEACHERS IN ADVANCE, SUPPORTS THEIR EFFORTS TO DEVELOP IN CLASS CURRICULUM AROUND THE TOPIC OF OYSTERS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY, AND ASSISTS TEACHERS WITH SUPPORTING THE STUDENT-LED PROJECT THAT IS THE CAPSTONE OF A MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATION EXPERIENCE. THE PROGRAM WILL TEACH STUDENTS ABOUT THE ROLE OF OYSTERS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY, THE IMPORTANCE OF OYSTER REEFS, WA

TITLE: NORTHERN NECK MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEE) PROGRAM  OVERVIEW: THE MAIN GOAL OF THIS FRIEND OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK (FOR) PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT SUSTAINABLE MWEE PROGRAMS IN SCHOOL DIVISIONS IN THE NORTHERN NECK REGION OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK RIVER WATERSHED. IN ORDER TO MEET THIS GOAL, FOR WILL ACHIEVE THREE OBJECTIVES: (1) PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO TEACHERS AND ADMINISTRATORS ON CONTENT KNOWLEDGE AND MWEE DESIGN. (2) WORK WITH TEACHERS TO IMPLEMENT MWEES AT THEIR SCHOOLS. (3) WORK WITH SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO EMBED MWEE IN CURRICULUM MAPS AND GUIDES

THIS PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE AVAILABILITY AND USE OF SUITABLE PHYSICAL HABITATS AS WELL AS SPECIES' RELATIONSHIPS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS. WITH THIS PROPOSAL WE WANT TO FOCUS TO ASSESS AND QUANTIFY THE ABUNDANCE AND HABITAT UTILIZATION OF COMMERCIALLY AND RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT FEDERALLY MANAGED FINFISH SPECIES (BLACK SEA BASS, SUMMER FLOUNDER) IN BIOGENIC REEF AND SUBMERGED AQUATIC VEGETATION (SAV) HABITATS IN TANGIER SOUND AND POCOMOKE SOUND, TWO REGIONS OF THE LOWER CHESAPEAKE BAY.

APPLICANT: CENTRAL COLUMBIA SCHOOL DISTRICT (SD) TITLE: CENTRAL COLUMBIA SD ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PLAN FOR CAPACITY BUILDING & CURRICULUM PROGRAMMING OVERVIEW: THE CENTRAL COLUMBIA SCHOOL DISTRICT ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT WILL ALIGN K-12 PA STATE STANDARDS OF LEARNING TO HIGH-QUALITY ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE CURRICULUM, AND ENVIRONMENTAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES IN-AND-OUT OF THE CLASSROOM, AS WELL AS ROBUST PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TEACHERS ACROSS THE DISTRICT. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY AND ENHANCE THE SCHOOL DISTRICT'S ABILITY TO OFFER HIGH-IMPACT ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PROGRAMMING FOR STUDENTS, TEACHERS AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. THE SCHOOL DISTRICT'S COMMITMENT IS TO IMPLEMENT THE ALIGNED CURRICULUM (WITH ONGOING PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR ALL (27) TEACHERS) THAT CONSISTENTLY EMPLOYS THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY EDUCATION FOR EVERY STUDENT-LEARNER, ALLOWING EACH STUDENT AT LEAST ONE MEANINGFUL WATERSHED ED

APPLICANT: GETTYSBURG COLLEGE TITLE: PARTNERSHIP FOR ADAMS COUNTY ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY (PACE) OVERVIEW: PENNSYLVANIA RECENTLY APPROVED NEW SCIENCE STANDARDS TO BE IMPLEMENTED OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS. SURVEYS AND FORUMS RECENTLY CONDUCTED BY ADVANCING SCIENCE REVEALED EDUCATOR CONCERN WITH THE NEW ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY (ELIT) AND SUSTAINABILITY COMPONENTS. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO OVERCOME THIS BARRIER BY ESTABLISHING AN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE THAT WILL BUILD, IMPLEMENT, AND SUSTAIN AN ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PLAN FOR ADAMS COUNTY K-12 SCHOOLS. THIS WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING AND STEWARDSHIP OF THE WATERSHED. THE PARTNERSHIP FOR ADAMS COUNTY ELIT (PACE) WILL ACHIEVE SEVERAL OBJECTIVES: ALIGN CURRICULUM WITH THE NEW PA ELIT AND SUSTAINABILITY STANDARDS, ESTABLISH NETWORK WEAVERS, GENERATE AND FULLY DOCUMENT A COUNTY ELIT PLAN, LEAD ROLLOUT OF THE PLAN, AND DISSEMINATE THE PLAN TO OTHER PA SCHOOL DISTRICTS. PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR 18 TEACHERS

APPLICANT: HANOVER-CAROLINE SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT TITLE: BUILDING CAPACITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY IN VIRGINIA'S MIDDLE PENINSULA OVERVIEW: CAROLINE, ESSEX, AND MIDDLESEX PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICTS ARE DIVERSE COMMUNITIES IN VIRGINIA'S MIDDLE PENINSULA. THE HANOVER-CAROLINE SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT AND ITS KEY PARTNERS, ALLIANCE FOR THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND FRIENDS OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK (FOR), WILL BRING AN INNOVATIVE APPROACH FOR ADVANCING ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY TO THE REGION.  IN YEAR ONE, PARTNERS WILL USE RESULTS FROM COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES TO CREATE COMMUNITY NETWORKS AND FACILITATE THE FORMATION OF LOCAL WORKGROUPS SERVING AS A BACKBONE TO SUPPORT SCHOOLS.  IN THE SECOND YEAR, SCHOOL ADMINISTRATION AND TEACHERS, CHESAPEAKE BAY GOVERNOR'S SCHOOL, RAPPAHANNOCK COMMUNITY COLLEGE, AND THE LOCAL WORKGROUPS WILL ASSIST KEY PARTNERS IN WRITING FLEXIBLE AND LOCALLY RELEVANT ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY PLANS WHICH LEVERAGE COMMUNITY-BASED RESOURCES FOR MEANING

VIRGINIA TEACHERS INNOVATING AND DESIGNING EXPERIENTIAL SCIENCE (VA TIDES) - PHASE 2 WILL PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE, ALIGNED RESOURCES FOR FACULTY AT INSTITUTES OF HIGHER EDUCATION TO UTILIZE WITHIN COURSES TAUGHT FOR PRE-SERVICE TEACHERS (PST). THE PST MWEE EDUCATION HUB WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO RESOURCES FOR TEACHER PREPARATION PROGRAMS TO USE WHEN TEACHING ABOUT MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATION EXPERIENCES (MWEES). THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE MANY OPPORTUNITIES FOR FEEDBACK FROM ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROVIDERS, VATIDES FACULTY ALUMNI, AND TEACHER EDUCATOR FACULTY ACROSS THE NATION. THE HUB WILL ALSO SERVE AS A CONNECTING POINT FOR THESE DIFFERENT AUDIENCES TO BUILD PARTNERSHIPS FOR CONTINUED ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION WITHIN INSTITUTES OF HIGHER LEARNING.

APPLICANT: MARYLAND ASSOCIATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND OUTDOOR EDUCATION TITLE: MARYLAND ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY ADVISORY NETWORK OVERVIEW: THE MARYLAND ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY ADVISORY NETWORK (ADVISORY NETWORK) IS A GROUP OF FORMAL AND NON-FORMAL EDUCATION PROFESSIONALS FROM A DIVERSITY OF PERSPECTIVES DEDICATED TOWARD THE ADVANCEMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY. THE VISION OF THE ADVISORY NETWORK IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY AND INCREASE COLLABORATION OF EXISTING STATE-WIDE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY NETWORKS TO ENSURE ALL STUDENTS IN MARYLAND ARE ENVIRONMENTALLY LITERATE UPON GRADUATION. BY GRADUATING ENVIRONMENTALLY LITERATE STUDENTS WHO ARE KNOWLEDGEABLE, SKILLED IN MAKING INFORMED DECISIONS, AND ABLE TO TAKE ACTIONS TO ADDRESS THE COMPLEX ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES INFLUENCING HUMAN HEALTH, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND COMMUNITIES, WE ENABLE THE FUTURE SUCCESS OF OUR SOCIETY.

APPLICANT: NATIONAL CAREER TECHNICAL EDUCATION FOUNDATION TITLE: DEVELOPING A STATE FRAMEWORK FOR INCORPORATING ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY IN CTE OVERVIEW: ADVANCE CTE WILL PARTNER WITH THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (DDOE) AND DELAWARE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE TO DEVELOP AN ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY FRAMEWORK THAT CAN BE USED ALONGSIDE THE NATIONAL CAREER CLUSTERS(R) FRAMEWORK TO EMBED ENVIRONMENTAL COMPETENCIES IN CTE PROGRAMS AND PATHWAYS AS WELL AS OTHER INTERDISCIPLINARY ACADEMIC AREAS AT THE MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL LEVEL. THE FRAMEWORK WILL IDENTIFY A SET OF ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY COMPETENCIES APPLICABLE TO EACH OF THE 16 CAREER CLUSTERS AND THAT SUPPORT STUDENTS IN DEVELOPING THEIR UNIQUE ENVIRONMENTAL IDENTITY, ARE ESSENTIAL FOR THE WORKFORCE OF THE FUTURE, AND CAN BE EASILY INTEGRATED INTO CTE PROGRAMS. ADVANCE CTE WILL WORK WITH STATE LEADERS TO INTEGRATE THE FRAMEWORK INTO STATE ADMINISTRATIVE POLICY AND BY DEVELOPING AND DELIVERING A PROFESSIONAL LEARNIN

APPLICANT: STROUD WATER RESEARCH CENTER, INC. TITLE: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE AND EQUITABLE CAPACITY SUPPORT SYSTEMS TOWARDS ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY FOR ALL K-12 AUDIENCES ACROSS PENNSYLVANIA OVERVIEW: THE PENNSYLVANIA ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE (PA ELIT/MWEE) CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS HAVE PROGRESSED TO THE NEXT PHASE WHICH NECESSITATES A RESTRUCTURED ORGANIZATIONAL FLOW. REGIONAL HUBS AND LIAISONS ALONG WITH THE STANDARDIZED PROCESSES AND RESOURCES TO DISTRIBUTE ELIT AND MWEE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND REFINED AS STRUCTURES AND PROCESSES TO STRENGTHEN NETWORKS AND ENHANCE COMMUNICATION STRATEGIES TO SUSTAIN EFFORTS TOWARD THE VISION OF SYSTEMIC MWEE IMPLEMENTATION IN ALL PENNSYLVANIA SCHOOL DISTRICTS.

APPLICANT: BLAST INTERMEDIATE UNIT #17 TITLE: GET 'OUTSIDEE' (ONGOING UNDERSTANDING THROUGH SCIENCE INQUIRY AND DIVERSE ENVIRONMENTAL EXPERIENCES) OVERVIEW: AS PENNSYLVANIA LOOKS TO ADOPT NEW ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND SUSTAINABILITY, TECHNOLOGY AND ENGINEERING, AND SCIENCE STANDARDS FOR THE 2022-2023 SCHOOL YEAR, THE SHIFT IN SCIENCE EDUCATION, ESPECIALLY ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE EDUCATION, IS SIGNIFICANT AND A NEED FOR SAYRE AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT WHO CURRENTLY IS REVISING THEIR SCIENCE CURRICULUM. SAYRE SITS ON APPROXIMATELY 33 SQUARE MILES AND HAS THE CAPACITY TO UTILIZE SCHOOL GROUNDS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EXPERIENCES, SAYRE IS LOCATED IN BRADFORD COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA AND IS IDENTIFIED AS AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREA WITH ABOUT 21% AT THE POVERTY LINE. BY BUILDING SUSTAINABLE AND SYSTEMIC MEANINGFUL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION EXPERIENCES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SAYRE AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS, LEARNERS WILL HAVE THE ABILITY TO EXPERIENCE GROWTH OF NEW, INNOVATIVE LEARNING OPP

APPLICANT: VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITY TITLE: PETERSBURG ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVITIES AND REGIONAL LEARNING (PEARL) OVERVIEW: THIS PROJECT INITIATIVE WILL PROVIDE TRANSFORMATIONAL LEARNING ABOUT WATERSHED EDUCATION IN THE PETERSBURG CITY PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT LOCATED ALONG THE APPOMATTOX RIVER IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED. MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATION EXPERIENCES (MWEES) ARE USED AS THE CONTEXTUAL THEME CONNECTING STUDENTS TO THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH AN ECOLOGICAL LENS. STUDENTS WILL ENGAGE IN MWEE INVESTIGATIONS, SUPPORTED BY APPROXIMATELY 29 TEACHERS WHO RECEIVE PERIODIC PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT USING NOAA EDUCATION MODULES AND OTHER TRAINING MATERIALS THAT ARE INFORMED BY ALIGNED RESEARCH FROM SCIENTISTS AND GRADUATE STUDENTS FROM VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITY (VCU) LIFE SCIENCES, THE VCU SCHOOL OF EDUCATION, AND THE SCIENCE MUSEUM OF VIRGINIA. STUDENTS WILL MAKE MAPS OF THEIR WATERSHED USING DRONE PHOTOGRAPHY, PARTICIPATE IN ABIOTIC AND BIOTIC WATER QUALITY ANALYSES A

APPLICANT: YORK COUNTY SCHOOL DIVISION TITLE: FOSTERING BAY STEWARDSHIP BY BUILDING CAPACITY TO LEAD MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEES) OVERVIEW: THE GOAL OF THE "FOSTERING BAY STEWARDSHIP BY BUILDING CAPACITY TO LEAD MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEES)" PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN SCIENCE BY ENHANCING TEACHERS' PROFESSIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND IMMERSING STUDENTS IN AUTHENTIC LEARNING EXPERIENCES WHILE FOCUSING ON STEWARDSHIP OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED. THROUGH A COHORT PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT MODEL, 4TH AND 5TH GRADE TEACHERS WILL DEVELOP THE CAPACITY TO ENGAGE STUDENTS IN MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EXPERIENCES THAT DEEPEN STUDENTS' UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES THAT IMPACT THEIR LOCAL WATERSHED. OVER THIS THREE-YEAR PROGRAM, THE YORK COUNTY SCHOOL DIVISION (YCSD) WILL PARTNER WITH THE JAMES RIVER ASSOCIATION (JRA) TO DELIVER RIGOROUS PROFESSIONAL LEARNING FOR APPROXIMATELY SIXTY 4TH AND 5TH GRADE TEACHERS THROUGH A CO

APPLICANT: PALEONTOLOGICAL RESEARCH INSTITUTION TITLE: A WATERSHED OF TREES: A MWEE TO ENGAGE STUDENTS AT THE INTERSECTION OF FOREST, WATER, CLIMATE, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP OVERVIEW: THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO GET CHILDREN OUTSIDE IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITY TO OBSERVE, RECORD, MONITOR, AND BUILD UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPORTANCE OF WATER AND CLIMATE ON THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AND EMPOWER THEM TO ACT ON THAT UNDERSTANDING. THEY WILL DO THIS BY STUDYING THE IMPACT OF TREES ON THE MOVEMENT OF WATER THROUGH THE WATERSHED AND THE SUBSEQUENT CHANGES IN MICROCLIMATE AND WATER QUALITY THAT ARISE FROM WATER-VEGETATION INTERACTIONS. TREES HAVE BEEN CHOSEN AS THE CENTRAL PLAYER IN THIS PROPOSED DISTRICT-WIDE MWEE BECAUSE (1) THEY ARE PRESENT IN SCHOOLYARDS IN EACH OF THE DIVERSE ECOSYSTEMS THAT COMPRISE THE COUNTY, FROM URBAN TO AGRICULTURAL, (2) THE PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF TREES PROFOUNDLY IMPACTS WATER MOVEMENT AND WATER QUALITY, WITH ADDITIONAL IMPACTS ON AM

APPLICANT: CHESAPEAKE BAY FOUNDATION TITLE: PENNSYLVANIA ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION TEAMS OVERVIEW: PENNSYLVANIA ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION TEAMS (PEATS) WILL BUILD AND STRENGTHEN EFFECTIVE MWEES INTO SUSTAINED AND SYSTEMIC STUDENT-LED ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION. THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH THREE LOCAL TEAMS, WITHIN THE CAPITAL AREA INTERMEDIATE UNIT SERVICE AREA, COMPRISED OF TEACHERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHOM WILL COLLABORATE ON BUILDING AND MAINTAINING SUCCESSFUL AND FULL MWEES. PEATS WILL ENGAGE PARTICIPATING TEACHERS IN FIELD-BASED PEDAGOGY AND CURRICULUM WRITING, AS WELL AS TRAIN PRESERVICE TEACHERS THAT WILL SUPPORT THE TEACHERS IN THEIR MWEE IMPLEMENTATION. PEATS WILL ALSO GROW LOCAL NETWORKS INCLUDING NON-TRADITIONAL PARTNERS SUCH AS GARDEN CLUBS OR LIBRARY STAFF TO SUPPORT DIFFERENT ASPECTS OF THEIR LOCAL MWEES. CBF, DCNR, SHIPPENSBURG UNIVERSITY, AND THE CAIU WILL SUPPORT PARTICIPATING TEACHERS IN ENSURING THE MOST CHALLENGING PARTS OF A MWEE: AUTHENTIC FIELD INVESTIGATIONS AND STUDENT-LED

APPLICANT: FRIENDS OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK (FOR) TITLE: RIVER HISTORY AND WATERSHED SCIENCE: A COMMUNITY BASED APPROACH TO MEANINGFUL WATERSHED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES (MWEES) OVERVIEW: THE MAIN GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT SUSTAINABLE MWEE PROGRAMS IN FREDERICKSBURG CITY SCHOOLS, WITHIN THE RAPPAHANNOCK RIVER WATERSHED. IN ORDER TO MEET THIS GOAL, FOR WILL REACH ALL OF THE FOURTH, SIXTH AND NINTH GRADE STUDENTS IN THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE NOAA STAFF FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT, THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM'S BAY BACKPACK, THE MWEE GUIDE, PLUS THE MWEE 101 AND 201 ONLINE COURSES.
